info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 1:02PM MDT until July 07 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar in... Northwestern San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 400 PM MDT. * At 102 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated an isolated, but strong thunderstorm producing heavy rain over the far southeastern portion of the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.75 to 1.25 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact the Tecolote Creek drainage area including Cabo Lucero Creek, Canon Mesteno, Ojitos Frios Creek and Tecolote Creek. Portions of Gallina Creek may also be impacted. Any debris flows can consist of water, ash, soot, rock, mud, burned vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding and possible debris flows within southeastern parts of the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Montezuma, El Porvenir, Storrie Lake State Park, Romeroville, San Geronimo, Mineral Hill, Gallinas, San Pablo and Ojitos Frios. This includes the following highways... State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 12...and near Mile Marker 14. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 518 near Mile Marker 7. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 338 and 343. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.75-1.25 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
